definitions: To change the order or position of (two or more things).
To transfer (a figure, term, or quantity) from one side of an equation to the other, usually with a corresponding change of sign.
To write or play (music) in a different key.
To transfer (a gene or segment of DNA) to another position on the same or a different chromosome.
examples: You can transpose the letters to form a new word.
Transpose the term to the other side of the equation.
The band decided to transpose the song into a higher key.
Scientists can transpose genes between organisms.
